course_title: Research in Sports and Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse literature and use this background in the development of scientific questions that can be addressed with directed research
Formulate and carry out a research project including the development of hypotheses, methodology, statistical analysis, and time management.
Prepare and present research findings for an oral defence
Prepare an original research manuscript suitable for publication in a scientific journal.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to demonstrate the ability to contribute to and work as part of a team with a common professional purpose. This will include planning and preparation, communication, contribution and active participation in all learning activities. This component is a pass/fail mark which assesses the individual students’ engagement and performance through the processes involved in optimising the chance of a successful research project.

This assessment item is Pass/fail and must be passed for students to pass the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Each student is required to submit the background (introduction) section to their research project. The background will contain the necessary evidence that justifies and supports the research question being addressed in the research project. Each student will prepare and submit a separate (individual)background. This submission has a maximum of 500 words (excluding the title and reference list).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each student will participate in a VIVA examination where they will speak about their research project for 7 minutes. This should cover sufficient information to convey the need for the research, the question addressed, the methods used, the results and implications of these results (e.g., clinical, research). The student will then answer questions from the examiners (8 minutes).

To assist the examiners one 250 word abstract will be submitted per group.

The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The group abstract is to be submitted Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Each group will write a manuscript based on their research findings that is suitable for submission to a peer-review journal. The manuscript must be written according to the guidelines of the selected journal and be less than 3500 words (excluding the abstract, tables, figures and references). The manuscript cannot exceed 3500 words, even if the selected journal allows a greater word count. The author guidelines for the selected journal must also be submitted as an Appendices with the manuscript. Please note that this is group assessment item.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Group Research Project

Students will be allocated to a research group which will be assigned a research mentor/advisor. Research groups will work with their advisor to complete their research project.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Group Research Project Students will be allocated to a research group which will be assigned a research mentor/advisor. Research groups will work with their advisor to complete their research project.

learning_activities.topic:
Online lecture series

This course contains a series of interactive lectures on how to write a journal article and how to undertake the research methodology being used to answer the research questions.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Online lecture series This course contains a series of interactive lectures on how to write a journal article and how to undertake the research methodology being used to answer the research questions.
